articles.title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
articles.description:
"Due to the timing and previously scheduled academic and professional commitments following the Games, the athletes are unable to participate."

The post US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: US women's hockey declines State of the Union invite due to scheduling conflicts.
Men's hockey team also received an invitation following a viral call with Donald Trump.
Boston residents may miss local athletes' representation at national events like the State of the Union.

articles.title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
articles.description:
Cutting Gibson frees up a little over in $3 million in cap space for New England.

The post Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson on February 23, 2026.
This decision frees up over $3 million in cap space.
Local fans may see changes in team strategy and roster moves.

articles.title: Feds investigate shooting at New Hampshire-Canada border crossing; suspect hospitalized
articles.description:
The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation said the incident occurred at about 1 a.m. Sunday morning in Pittsburg, a town of about 800 people at the border with Canada.

The post Feds investigate shooting at New Hampshire-Canada border crossing; suspect hospitalized appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: FBI investigates a shooting incident at the New Hampshire-Canada border crossing.
Shooting occurred at 1 a.m. on Sunday in Pittsburg, a town of 800 residents.
Local authorities are on high alert due to the incident's proximity to Boston.

articles.title: BAFTA and BBC apologize for racial slur during awards show
articles.description:
The Tourette syndrome campaigner who shouted the slur said he was "deeply mortified” and what he said was “not a reflection of my personal beliefs.”

The post BAFTA and BBC apologize for racial slur during awards show appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: BAFTA and BBC issued apologies for a racial slur during the awards show.
Tourette syndrome campaigner expressed deep remorse, stating it doesn't reflect his beliefs.
The incident raises awareness about language sensitivity in Boston's entertainment community.

articles.title: Israeli settlers kill 19-year-old Palestinian American, officials and witnesses say
articles.description:
The Palestinian Ministry of Health confirmed Nasrallah Abu Siyam's death from critical wounds sustained Wednesday afternoon near the village east of Ramallah.

The post Israeli settlers kill 19-year-old Palestinian American, officials and witnesses say appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Israeli settlers killed 19-year-old Palestinian American Nasrallah Abu Siyam near Ramallah on Wednesday.
The Palestinian Ministry of Health confirmed his death from critical wounds sustained during the incident.
Boston residents may feel heightened tensions and concerns regarding Middle East relations following this event.

articles.title: Former Connecticut police chief arrested over alleged $85,000 theft from department funds
articles.description:
Karl Jacobson, 56, who abruptly retired from the department in January, turned himself in on an arrest warrant.

The post Former Connecticut police chief arrested over alleged $85,000 theft from department funds appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Karl Jacobson, 56, arrested for allegedly stealing $85,000 from department funds.
Jacobson retired abruptly in January before turning himself in on February 23.
The incident raises concerns about financial oversight in local police departments.

articles.title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
articles.description:
Blizzard status achieved ✅. What does that mean?

The post Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston officially declared a blizzard as of February 23, 2026.
Meteorologists report snowfall rates exceeding 2 inches per hour in some areas.
Residents should prepare for potential travel disruptions and power outages.
